intro: Elaphoglossum erinaceum var. occidentale, commonly known as the western hairy shield fern, is a species of fern native to western North America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. It plays a role in forest ecosystems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
